body: This seems a side effect of the connection shutdown changes we made in 8.9. I assume that the shutdown triggers the socket monitoring, but then never causes the sockets to be removed again. Or do you seen "unkown" sockets to appear there?
They're not unknown, they're all ones that have been used for previous requests.
Is there a particular commit I could try backing out to see if that fixes it?
That would be difficult. It was a larger operation. I'll have a look at it next week, see what I can find. Can you build a libcurl with which we can test changes?
Yeah we can build whatever patches you provide and say what it says

I seems to have exact issue, though the event loop library is different (sd-event in systemd, which is based on epoll).

In my case there is only one host that the program will make https request with. The behavior I observed is that certain fd with POLL_IN that will continuously fire and causing 100% cpu. Call curl_multi_socket_action doesn't seem to clear up the event.

issue.title: Curl 8.9.0 causes 100% cpu use
issue.body: Running rtorrent on Arch. After updating curl to 8.9.0, rtorrent uses 100% cpu. Downgrading back to 8.8.0 fixes the issue.

body: Seeing similar behavior when running rtorrent.

I made #14283 with extra DEBUG output on connection shutdown and its event handling. If you could build a libcurl with `--enable-debug` and set a CURLOPT_DEBUGFUNCTION on the transfers, we should get some traces to show us what is going wrong, hopefully.

issue.title: 异常持续高 CPU 占用
issue.body:
### Summary

### 问题简述

在运行 fcitx5 后 10 分钟左右会占满一个核心的 CPU, 并且会一直持续没有要停下来的意思

![图片](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6cd2d760-ce44-40d2-b18e-f3a9530349ae)

### 尝试分析

在 Arch Linux CN 群组依云的提议和帮助下抓取了 perf 并生成了火焰图

![fcitx](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cacb975f-0235-4fed-b01f-2025b7583614)

这是 perf 原始数据和 stackcollapse-perf 的中间输出

[fcitx-perf.tar.gz](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/16389253/fcitx-perf.tar.gz)

以及通过 strace 抓取的大量 `epoll_pwait2`

[strace.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/16389314/strace.txt)



### Steps to Reproduce

运行 fcitx5 然后等待 10 分钟左右, 中间使用电报聊聊天或者就这样放着

### Expected Behavior

正常运行

body:
Thanks for the log! I see that we are on the right track. The sockets are, correctly, added for shutting down the connections in the multi's connection cache when they are considered to be "too old". But the cache's is never called in invoke the events on these sockets.

I added a fix for that and some additional logging to #14283. Could you run that again in your setup? Thanks!
There was a segfault in the debug (`data->conn` can be `nullptr`) but I dealt with that and the fix seems to have fixed it. CPU is back to normal and no spurious callbacks.

Thanks for the quick test! I'll work on the real fix next week, now that I know where the deficiencies are.

What fix did you apply?

Just printing None instead of `connection_id` if `data->conn` was NULL

On Sat, Jul 27, 2024, 11:28 Stefan Eissing ***@***.***> wrote:

> Thanks for the quick test! I'll work on the real fix next week, now that I
> know where the deficiencies are.
>
> What fix did you apply?
>
> —
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/curl/curl/issues/14280#issuecomment-2254106759>, or
> unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AEUWJUSNYUPZFIRJRDTDEGDZONY45AVCNFSM6AAAAABLQVBVRKVHI2DSMVQWIX3LMV43OSLTON2WKQ3PNVWWK3TUHMZDENJUGEYDMNZVHE>
> .
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.Message ID:
> ***@***.***>
>

issue.title: fix connection shutdown for event based processing

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

issue.body:
connections being shutdown would register sockets for events, but then never remove these sockets again. Nor would the shutdown effectively been performed. See #14280

- If a socket event involves a transfer, check if that is the connection cache internal handle and run its multi_perform() instead (the internal handle is used for all shutdowns).
- When a timer triggers for a transfer, check also if it is about the connection cache internal handle.
- During processing shutdowns in the connection cache, assess the shutdown timeouts. Register a Curl_expire() of the lowest value for the cache's internal handle.
- do connection shutdown under the same `sigpipe` handling as other transfers

issue.title: Nheko 100% one core

repository.name: nheko
repository.description: Desktop client for Matrix using Qt and C++20.

issue.body:
### Describe the bug

Nheko opens at 56% cpu usage in one core, which then slowly increases to 100% in around 1 minute

![image](https://github.com/Nheko-Reborn/nheko/assets/26150581/a4431037-2507-46f7-acaf-54bfc40aae05)

I'll try to debug the problem, which was introduced last month (April 2024), maybe due to a qt6 package upgrade or nheko change. Just reporting the issue for now.

### To Reproduce/Environment

1. Open nheko

Version: commit g9abc44ef
Theme: Breeze
QT_QPA_PLATFORMTHEME="qt6ct"

### Operating system

Linux

### Installation method

AUR

### Qt version

qt6-base 6.6.2

issue.title: busy `epoll_wait` 100% CPU usage

repository.name: mpdscribble
repository.description: a MPD client which submits information about tracks being played to a scrobbler (e.g. last.fm)

issue.body:
```
$ mpdscribble -V | head -1

$ pgrep mpdscribble

$ timeout 5s strace -c -p 222341
```

issue.title: issues with curl 8.9.0
issue.body: @aarond10 @baranyaib90 I've already tagged you gentlemen in the downstream issue: https://github.com/openwrt/packages/issues/24693 but I wonder if the https_dns_proxy has been successfully tested on generic Linux distributions with curl/libcurl 8.9.0?
